intro: Cybianthus costaricanus subsp. morii, commonly known as the Morii's cybianthus, is a species of flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral morphology and limited distribution.
